channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: Takaichi Landslide Shows Limits of Chinese Economic Coercion
item.description: Philip Luck examines the recent Japanese election, highlighting how economic coercion against democracies can often strengthen government support and influence electoral outcomes.

item.title: India’s New Ambitions on Trade Must Be Paired with Domestic Reform
item.description: India’s new trade confidence, marked by deals with the United States and the EU, signals a break from protectionism. But trade gains won’t stick without deep domestic reforms, especially at the state level, where land, labor, and power policies will decide success.

item.title: Haiti Embarks on Another Rocky Political Transition
item.description: CSIS Americas Senior Associate Georges Fauriol and Mary Speck analyze Haiti’s future directions as the country’s Transitional Presidential Council ends and a new interim government takes office.

item.title: U.S.-India and EU-India Trade Agreements: Who Won?
item.description: This week, Bill Reinsch compares India's latest trade agreements with the United States and European Union.
